1.body: Ownership Buy/sell Profit & risk Mudarabah Murabahah
1.title: Business

10.body: Tradable. Price based on market price. Passively managed (because the group of assets don’t really change mich); the fund holds all or most of the same stocks as the index that is being tracked.
10.title: ETF

11.body: aka loans Characteristics: Regular payments Guaranteed interest
11.title: Fixed income

12.body: Buy a futures contract for k barrels at $p per barrel, delivery in m months. If the market price is more than $p, one will sell the contract before delivery. “Sale of a promise” rather than “sale of an asset” In practice, both parties close their position early.
12.title: Futures

13.body: Strategy: Borrow k shares from the broker. Sell the k shares at $q. Wait for market price to drop. Buy back the shares at $p. Return the share to the broker (with interest?). Profit = $q - $p Warning Short selling can move the market. Islamic perspective Selling what you don't own. Riba. Gharar.
13.title: Short selling

14.body: The thing that you buy must actually exist 1 Can I buy and sell ownership of company? How often can I buy and sell? Valid sale clear ownership Full payment or clear terms Riba is only twice the amount and above based on 3:130?
14.title: Shariah laws

15.body: Written contract [1] Collateral [1] Witnesses [1] Defaulting — mercy [2] Demanding more money is riba [3] Money lending is considered charity Excess amount Delayed settlement [3:130]
15.title: Loan / money lending

16.body: = guaranteed profit = necessarily creates disadvantage, unfair burden, injustice, even if not immediately. الغنم بالغرم There is no profit without risk Gaining money from goods/services Gaining money from money (except currency) Profit from good/ services Profit from lending money
16.title: Guaranteed returns

17.body: It becomes riba only if you are effectively giving the buyer a cash advance (i.e. a loan of money) and then demanding back more money as “interest.” Allah has permitted trade and forbidden riba (interest) [1] Agreeing to a riba in contract is problematic because you are implicated. borrower, lender, writer, witnesses [2]
17.title: Riba

18.body: riba an-nasi’ah Whether flat fee or a percentage of the principal loan Views for permissible — actual cost-recovery Views for not permissible Interest vs. different pricing Surah Al-Baqarah 2:275 Gold for gold, silver for silver, wheat for wheat, barley for barley, dates for dates, salt for salt — equal for equal, same for same, hand to hand. If they differ, then sell as you wish, provided it is hand to hand. (Sahih Muslim 1587, also in Bukhari) The Messenger of Allah cursed the one who consumes riba, the one who pays it, the one who records it, and the two witnesses to it, and he said: They are all the same. Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1598
18.title: Late payment fee

19.body: Do not sell what you do not possess. [1] Sahih Muslim 1513
19.title: Buying and selling

2.title: Finance

22.body: Create actual value Create goods or service Transfer ownership of things Note You meet real needs.
22.breadcrumbs: Real economic activity » Real economic activity
22.title: Real economic activity

23.body: مرابحة Mark-up مداربة Profit sharing A financial instrument is anything (asset that holds monetary value or contract) that can be traded. Leveraged products amplify your exposure to the movement of an asset i.e. make or lose more than you invest. Examples: CDF Options Futures Leveraged ETFs Margin trading
23.title: Glossary

4.body: Capital gains Dividend income Short-term profits Portfolio diversification Wealth accumulation Hedging
4.title: Trading goals

5.title: Shariah laws

6.body: An index consists of a group of assets. Purpose: to track the performance of a specific section of the market
6.title: Index

7.body: Tradable. Price based on market price. Trading a portion of a company that you own Selling a share in a business to another. Buyer receives rights to profits.
7.title: Stocks

8.body: A pool of money from many investors. Purpose: buys assets based on a strategy Holdings are typically published.
8.title: Fund

9.body: aka mutual fund, fund Not traded. Unit price based on NAV. Actively managed. Investor receives units that represent their share in the fund.
9.breadcrumbs: Fund » Mutual fund / unit trust » Mutual fund / unit trust
9.title: Mutual fund / unit trust
